intro: Oncidium blossfeldianum, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its pendulous, showy inflorescences that feature bright yellow and green flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its roots are adapted for absorbing moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. Oncidium blossfeldianum requires bright, indirect light and consistent humidity to thrive.
